Covered events include serious injury/illness (confirmed overseas)/death of insured/travel companion/family member, witness duty, home damage, serious public event, hijack (>12 hours).

Covers additional admin expenses to amend return ticket OR additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard) for immediate return if ticket cannot be amended. Must seek refunds from providers first; claim reduced by refunds received (cash, vouchers, credits etc.). Excludes upgrades, cost of original unused return ticket, additional expenses if no return ticket originally booked, public transport like buses/taxis.

Pays if trip is cancelled before departure or disrupted overseas because a travel agent, transport provider, tour operator, or accommodation provider responsible for part/all of trip is declared insolvent.
Insolvency means unable to pay debts and ceased operations due to declared insolvency/bankruptcy, or owner under investigation for/convicted of fraud/dishonesty, or owner absconded with funds.
Covers non-refundable pre-paid costs (accommodation, transport, excursions etc.) and additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard) due to insolvency. Excludes refunds/compensation received.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, What we pay / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Excludes claims if policy bought less than 72 hours before scheduled departure.

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours diverted while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays S$100 for every 6 continuous hours you are diverted to another destination while travelling on an airplane, before reaching your scheduled destination.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 12, Trip diversion; Page 13, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires written proof of diversion from provider/agent showing duration and reason.
Excludes diversions caused by you, your family member or travel companion.
General Exclusions apply.

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours delay while overseas
S$100 for the first six hours delay in Singapore only

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if scheduled public transport is delayed, or you are forced to travel at another time due to overbooking, for 6 continuous hours or more before reaching scheduled destination.
Pays S$100 for every 6 continuous hours of delay overseas. For delays in Singapore, pays S$100 only for the first 6 hours. Calculated from original scheduled arrival to actual arrival time.
Requires check-in on time for original booking. Requires written proof of delay from provider/agent showing duration and reason.
Excludes delays caused by you, your family member or travel companion.
General Exclusions apply.

base_limits.basis: S$100 for every six hours you are stranded

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if you miss a travel connection because your incoming scheduled public transport arrives late at the transit terminal, and no alternative travel is available within 6 hours of the scheduled departure of your next connection.
Pays S$100 for every 6 continuous hours you are stranded.
Requires check-in on time for original booking. Requires written proof of delay from provider/agent showing duration and reason.
Excludes delays caused by you, your family member or travel companion.
General Exclusions apply.

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if trip is disrupted in Singapore or overseas, forcing itinerary change due to: serious injury/illness making you unfit to travel (confirmed by doctor), serious public event, or flight cancellation by airline due to airport/runway/airspace closure or poor weather.

Covers additional transport/accommodation (economy/standard) to continue trip OR unused pre-paid transport/accommodation due to itinerary change. Must seek refunds first; claim reduced by refunds received. Excludes extending trip beyond original schedule, upgrades, airline faults (crew rotation etc.).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 13, What we pay / What is not covered; Page 14, What you're covered for

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pre-existing condition cover requires purchase of optional add-on, applies 50% co-payment, covers disruption due to serious injury/illness from pre-existing condition. Excludes claims for terminal illness.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 23, Trip disruption; Page 25, What is not covered; Page 26, For all benefits under Pre-existing...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General Exclusions apply.
Provides cover under the policy benefits for claims resulting directly from an act of terrorism during the trip, subject to the limits and conditions of each benefit.
Act of terrorism defined as an act involving force/violence by person/group for political, religious, ideological purposes to influence government or put public in fear.
General Exclusions apply.

base_limits.basis: S$150 for every six hours of delay
S$150 for first six hour delay in Singapore only

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if checked-in baggage is delayed, misdirected, or misplaced by public transport provider and reaches 6+ continuous hours after arrival at destination (including return to Singapore).
Pays S$150 for each 6-hour period baggage is delayed (except only first 6 hours if delay occurs in Singapore). Calculated from scheduled arrival to actual baggage arrival.
Requires written proof from provider/agent stating name, date, time, delay duration, and reason. Paid per claim, not per bag. Only one person paid if multiple share bag.
General Exclusions apply.

coverages.coverage_name: Theft of or damage to baggage or personal belongings

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for all other items (per item)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if baggage/personal belongings are stolen, accidentally damaged, or lost by airline operator during trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, Theft of or damage to baggage or personal belongings

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays up to original purchase price; FWD decides repair, replacement, or cash. Depreciation applies based on item age and proof of purchase (POP). Mobile phone: [(24-age)/24]*POP or trade-in or S$50. Laptop/electronics: [(36-age)/36]*POP or S$50. Other belongings: [(60-age)/60]*POP or S$50. Jewellery: 100% POP. Without POP: current market value up to S$50/item, max 5 items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 14, How we decide how much to pay; Page 15, How much we pay table; Page 36, How we pay property claims

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Items must be carried by you (phones, laptops, tablets, jewellery) or under your care/authorised person's care. Not covered if checked-in (phones etc.) or left unattended in vehicle. Report theft to police/authority within 24 hours.

Excludes perishables, consumables, motorised vehicles, cards with value, wear & tear, musical instruments, unauthorised phone costs, items not yours, sports equipment (covered separately if add-on bought), business goods, stored info, unexplained loss.
Claim reduced by any amount paid under Baggage Delay benefit for the same items.
General Exclusions apply.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss of passport, travel documents & theft of money

base_limits.type: Sub-limit for theft of your money

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if passport/travel documents lost or money/travellers' cheques stolen while overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, Loss of passport, travel documents & theft of money

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses value of stolen cash/cheques (up to sub-limit) and costs to replace passport/documents overseas. No other expenses paid.

Items must be under your care, securely locked, or with authorised person. Money must be carried by you (not checked-in or left in unattended vehicle). Report loss/theft to police/authority within 24 hours. Call Emergency Assistance for advice on replacing documents.
General Exclusions apply.
Reimburses unauthorised charges made on your credit card while overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 16, Fraudulent personal credit card usage

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires reporting charges/theft to card issuer and police within 24 hours of discovery. Must follow card issuer's rules for unauthorised charges.
Excludes charges made by family member, travel companion, or person entrusted with card details.
General Exclusions apply.

source_specific_details.source_location: Page 6, Car rental excess; Page 9, Optional Covers

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: If optional cover purchased: Pays the excess/deductible you are legally liable for due to accidental loss/damage to a rental car from a licensed operator overseas. Requires you to be named driver, legally allowed to drive, driving at time of incident, and following rental agreement/local laws.
Requires providing rental agreement, receipts for excess paid, and related reports. Rental car must be collected overseas. One claim per rental car.
General Exclusions apply.

If optional cover purchased: Pays if sports equipment is stolen, accidentally damaged, or lost by airline/transport/accommodation provider during trip. Covers cost of renting replacement equipment (up to S$100/day) and compensation for the equipment.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 28, Sports equipment protector; Page 29, What we pay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covered equipment: golf clubs, diving gear, skis/boards/poles, snowboards, wakeboards, bicycles, fishing tackle, specialist apparel for diving/skiing/snowboarding.

Compensation based on depreciation and proof of purchase (POP). 100% POP if bought during trip. 70% POP if 1 yr old. 50% POP if 2 yrs old. 20% POP if 3+ yrs old. Without POP: current market value up to S$50/item, max 5 items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 29, How much we pay table

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Equipment must be under your care, securely locked, or with authorised person. Report theft to police/authority within 24 hours. Excludes damage during use (practice or play).
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 29, What you should know / What is not covered

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General Exclusions apply.

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: This benefit requires purchase of the optional 'Home contents' add-on.
If optional cover purchased: Pays if your home contents are lost or damaged due to fire or burglary while you are overseas on your trip.
Home contents means household furniture/furnishing, domestic electronic appliances, personal belongings owned by you and in your home. Excludes cash and travellers' cheques.

Compensation based on depreciation and proof of purchase (POP). 70% POP if <1 yr old. 50% POP if 1-2 yrs old. 30% POP if 2-3 yrs old. 20% POP if >3 yrs old. Without POP: current market value up to S$50/item, max 5 items.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 30, How much we pay table

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General Exclusions apply.

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, for claims directly arising from a pre-existing medical condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers; Page 24, Emergency medical evacuation & repatriation

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Requires calling Emergency Assistance (+65 6322 2072). Covers moving you to appropriate medical facility (overseas or Singapore) or returning you to Singapore for treatment if medically necessary due to life-threatening illness/injury overseas. Also covers return of mortal remains.

FWD decides appropriate facility and transport (air/surface ambulance, regular transport etc.). Pays for transport, admin fees to change tickets, reasonable overseas mortician costs (embalmment, cremation, basic casket/urn).

If optional Pre-existing conditions cover purchased: Reimburses expenses up to the limit (S$50k for Premium) for evacuation/repatriation due to life-threatening condition from pre-existing condition. Requires calling Emergency Assistance.
General Exclusions apply, including travel against medical advice, travel for medical treatment.

coverages.coverage_name: Personal liability while on your trip

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if you are held legally responsible for accidental death or bodily injury to another person, or loss/damage to another person's property, while overseas on a trip. Other person must not be an interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 17, Personal liability while on your trip

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays damages awarded by court (excluding punitive damages) and agreed legal costs for defence.
Requires not admitting liability or negotiating payment without FWD permission. FWD may take over defence. FWD must agree costs before engaging own lawyer.

Excludes criminal damages, property in your care/custody, liability from owning/using firearms, animals, motorised vehicles, watercraft, aircraft/drones, remote devices, bicycles. Excludes liability from trade/business/profession.
General Exclusions apply.

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays lump sum if you suffer an accident during the trip that causes death or total and permanent disability (TPD) within 90 days.
TPD means accident stops you working any job/business for 6 months and doctor considers unlikely to ever work again. Severance/loss of use must be diagnosed by approved doctor and beyond cure.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 18, Meaning of total and permanent disability / What you should know

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Benefit paid according to scale: 100% for death, TPD, loss of 2+ limbs/sight in both eyes, severe burns (>8% head/>20% body). 50% for loss of 1 limb/sight in one eye/hearing in one ear/speech, moderate burns (5-8% head/15-20% body). Max 100% payout per accident.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 18, Percentage of benefit limit table

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: If body not found after public transport disappears/wrecked/sinks, considered deceased after 1 year or official death certificate.
General Exclusions apply, including suicide/self-inflicted acts, professional/paid sports, speed contests.

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for medically necessary treatment overseas due to unexpected illness or injury suffered on the trip. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from first treatment.

Includes costs for: accidental dental injury treatment, ambulance, specialist (if referred by GP), medical equipment for recovery. Excludes mobility aids like crutches/wheelchairs (prosthesis excluded).
Excludes dental treatment for tooth/gum disease/wear, non-natural teeth (dentures, implants etc.), treatment by interested party, planned/pre-arranged treatment.

If optional Pre-existing conditions cover purchased: Reimburses medically necessary treatment overseas up to the limit (S$50k for Premium) for unexpected illness/injury directly due to pre-existing condition. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from first treatment. Excludes dental, Chinese med/physio/chiro, planned treatment, interested party.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 24, Medical expenses incurred overseas; Page 26, Medical expenses incurred overseas...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: General Exclusions apply, including travel against medical advice, travel for medical treatment, pregnancy/childbirth, alcohol/substance abuse.

base_limits.type: Per Day Limit (Intensive Care Unit - ICU)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily amount for each continuous 24-hour period confined to an overseas hospital due to unexpected illness/injury suffered on trip. Admission must be medically necessary.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Daily hospital cash while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Daily amount is doubled (up to S$400/day) if confined in an ICU.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 19, Double daily hospital cash benefit for ICU; Page 7, Daily hospital cash while overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Hospital definition excludes nursing homes, convalescence homes, psychiatric facilities etc.
General Exclusions apply.

conditional_limits.condition: With 'Pre-existing medical conditions' optional cover purchased, and extension needed due to pre-existing condition
conditional_limits.source_location: Page 9, Optional Covers; Page 24, Automatic policy extension

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Policy period automatically extended free of charge if return to Singapore delayed by serious public event, or if confined to overseas hospital on advice of medical practitioner.

If optional Pre-existing conditions cover purchased: Policy extends up to 30 days if delayed due to unexpected illness/injury from pre-existing condition making you unfit to travel, or confinement in overseas hospital due to pre-existing condition (requires doctor confirmation).

Reimburses costs of phone calls made while overseas to: FWD Emergency Assistance hotline (medical advice/lost documents), police, medical facilities, consulates, family members in Singapore for assistance due to serious illness/injury during trip.
General Exclusions apply.

Reimburses costs for one adult family member to travel to be with you, or for a travel companion to stay with you, if you suffer unexpected illness/injury overseas, are hospitalised for at least 5 continuous days, doctor confirms you cannot return to SG for treatment, and you have no adult family member with you.
Covers reasonable return economy transport and standard accommodation. Benefit stops 30 days after first confinement or when doctor confirms fit to travel/return, whichever is earlier.
If you die after being hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation visit, Child companion, or Compassionate travel) is payable (highest amount).
General Exclusions apply.

Reimburses costs for one adult family member to travel to be with your child(ren) if you suffer unexpected illness/injury overseas, are hospitalised for at least 5 continuous days, doctor confirms you cannot return to SG for treatment, you are travelling with child(ren), and you are the only adult.
Covers reasonable return economy transport and standard accommodation. Benefit stops 30 days after first confinement or when doctor confirms fit to travel/return, whichever is earlier.
If you die after being hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation visit, Child companion, or Compassionate travel) is payable (highest amount).
General Exclusions apply.

Reimburses costs for one adult family member to travel to arrange return of your body if you die from unexpected illness/injury suffered overseas on trip, and no other adult family member is on the trip.
Covers reasonable return economy transport and standard accommodation.
If you die after being hospitalised, only one benefit (Hospitalisation visit, Child companion, or Compassionate travel) is payable (highest amount).
General Exclusions apply.

coverages.coverage_name: Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist and chiropractor expenses

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays if you suffer unexpected illness/injury overseas and receive treatment overseas from Chinese medicine practitioner, physiotherapist, or chiropractor.

Treatment must be sought overseas or within 48 hours of returning to Singapore. Claimable only if you received medical treatment overseas for the same condition OR sought treatment within 48 hours of return for condition suffered overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Treatment while on a trip or within 48 hours...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Reimburses reasonable and necessary costs up to limit, capped at S$50 per visit. Covers treatment for up to 30 days from return date (if sought within 48 hours).
Excludes treatment by interested party.
General Exclusions apply.

base_limits.type: Child covered under a family plan

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays for medically necessary treatment in Singapore if needed after returning, due to unexpected illness/injury suffered overseas on trip.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Medical expenses incurred in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Treatment must be sought overseas or within 48 hours of returning to Singapore. Claimable only if you received medical treatment overseas for the same condition OR sought treatment within 48 hours of return for condition suffered overseas.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 20, Treatment must be sought overseas or within 48 hours...

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers treatment for up to 30 days from return date (if sought within 48 hours). Includes accidental dental injury, ambulance, specialist (if referred by GP), medical equipment. Excludes mobility aids (prosthesis excluded).
Excludes dental treatment for tooth/gum disease/wear, non-natural teeth, treatment by interested party.

Confinement must be within 48 hours of return OR within 30 days of return if medical treatment was sought during trip. Admission must be medically necessary.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 21, Daily hospital cash while in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Daily amount is doubled (up to S$200/day) if confined in an ICU.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 21, Double daily hospital cash benefit for ICU; Page 8, Daily hospital cash while in Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Hospital definition excludes nursing homes, convalescence homes, psychiatric facilities etc.

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: This benefit requires purchase of the optional 'Pet care' add-on.

If optional cover purchased: Pays S$50 for each 6-hour period your scheduled public transport returning to Singapore is delayed (for 6+ hours), provided you, family member or travel companion are not the cause, and your pet stayed in a pet hotel/kennel during the trip.
Delay calculated from original scheduled arrival to actual arrival time in Singapore.
General Exclusions apply.
